trans-unit.source: Control Windows Hello for Business settings on devices | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Control Windows Hello for Business settings on devices | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Learn how Intune integrates with Windows Hello for Business, an alternative sign-in method that uses Active Directory or an Azure Active Directory account to replace a password, smart card, or virtual smart card.
trans-unit.target: Learn how Intune integrates with Windows Hello for Business, an alternative sign-in method that uses Active Directory or an Azure Active Directory account to replace a password, smart card, or virtual smart card.

trans-unit.source: Control Windows Hello for Business settings on devices with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Control Windows Hello for Business settings on devices with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Intune integrates with Windows Hello for Business (formerly Microsoft Passport for Work), an alternative sign-in method that uses Active Directory or an Azure Active Directory account to replace a password, smart card, or a virtual smart card.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Intune integrates with Windows Hello for Business (formerly Microsoft Passport for Work), an alternative sign-in method that uses Active Directory or an Azure Active Directory account to replace a password, smart card, or a virtual smart card.

trans-unit.source: Hello for Business lets you use a *user gesture* to sign in, instead of a password.
trans-unit.target: Hello for Business lets you use a *user gesture* to sign in, instead of a password.

trans-unit.source: A user gesture might be a simple PIN, biometric authentication such as Windows Hello, or an external device such as a fingerprint reader.
trans-unit.target: A user gesture might be a simple PIN, biometric authentication such as Windows Hello, or an external device such as a fingerprint reader.

trans-unit.source: Intune integrates with Hello for Business in two ways:
trans-unit.target: Intune integrates with Hello for Business in two ways:

trans-unit.source: You can use an Intune policy to control which gestures users can and cannot use to sign in.
trans-unit.target: You can use an Intune policy to control which gestures users can and cannot use to sign in.

trans-unit.source: You can store authentication certificates in the Windows Hello for Business key storage provider (KSP).
trans-unit.target: You can store authentication certificates in the Windows Hello for Business key storage provider (KSP).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles in Microsoft Intune](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Secure resource access with certificate profiles in Microsoft Intune](secure-resource-access-with-certificate-profiles.md).

trans-unit.source: Create a Windows Hello for Business policy
trans-unit.target: Create a Windows Hello for Business policy

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management** > **Windows** > **Windows Hello for Business** to open the Windows Hello for Business page.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management** > **Windows** > **Windows Hello for Business** to open the Windows Hello for Business page.

trans-unit.source: Windows Hello for Business page
trans-unit.target: Windows Hello for Business page

trans-unit.source: Choose one of the following settings:
trans-unit.target: Choose one of the following settings:

trans-unit.source: **Disable Windows Hello for Business on enrolled devices**.
trans-unit.target: **Disable Windows Hello for Business on enrolled devices**.

trans-unit.source: If you don't want to use Windows Hello for Business, select this setting.
trans-unit.target: If you don't want to use Windows Hello for Business, select this setting.

trans-unit.source: All other settings on the screen are then unavailable.
trans-unit.target: All other settings on the screen are then unavailable.

trans-unit.source: **Enable Windows Hello for Business on enrolled devices**.
trans-unit.target: **Enable Windows Hello for Business on enrolled devices**.

trans-unit.source: Select this setting if you want to configure Windows Hello for Business settings.
trans-unit.target: Select this setting if you want to configure Windows Hello for Business settings.

trans-unit.source: **Not configured**.
trans-unit.target: **Not configured**.

trans-unit.source: Select this setting if you don't want to use Intune to control Windows Hello for Business settings.
trans-unit.target: Select this setting if you don't want to use Intune to control Windows Hello for Business settings.

trans-unit.source: Any existing Windows Hello for Business settings on Windows 10 devices will not be changed.
trans-unit.target: Any existing Windows Hello for Business settings on Windows 10 devices will not be changed.

trans-unit.source: All other settings on the screen are unavailable.
trans-unit.target: All other settings on the screen are unavailable.

trans-unit.source: If you selected **Enable Windows Hello for Business on enrolled devices**, configure the required settings that will be applied to all enrolled Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: If you selected **Enable Windows Hello for Business on enrolled devices**, configure the required settings that will be applied to all enrolled Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished, choose **Save**.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished, choose **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Settings for the Windows Hello for Business policy
trans-unit.target: Settings for the Windows Hello for Business policy

trans-unit.source: **Use a Trusted Platform Module (TPM)**.
trans-unit.target: **Use a Trusted Platform Module (TPM)**.

trans-unit.source: A TPM chip provides an additional layer of data security.
trans-unit.target: A TPM chip provides an additional layer of data security.

trans-unit.source: Choose one of the following values:
trans-unit.target: Choose one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: **Required** (default).
trans-unit.target: **Required** (default).

trans-unit.source: Only devices with an accessible TPM can provision Windows Hello for Business.
trans-unit.target: Only devices with an accessible TPM can provision Windows Hello for Business.

trans-unit.source: **Preferred**.
trans-unit.target: **Preferred**.

trans-unit.source: Devices first attempt to use a TPM.
trans-unit.target: Devices first attempt to use a TPM.

trans-unit.source: If this is not available, they can use software encryption.
trans-unit.target: If this is not available, they can use software encryption.

trans-unit.source: **Require minimum PIN length**/**Require maximum PIN length**.
trans-unit.target: **Require minimum PIN length**/**Require maximum PIN length**.

trans-unit.source: Configures devices to use the minimum and maximum PIN lengths that you specify to help ensure secure sign-in.
trans-unit.target: Configures devices to use the minimum and maximum PIN lengths that you specify to help ensure secure sign-in.

trans-unit.source: The default PIN length is 6 characters, but you can enforce a minimum length of 4 characters.
trans-unit.target: The default PIN length is 6 characters, but you can enforce a minimum length of 4 characters.

trans-unit.source: The maximum PIN length is 127 characters.
trans-unit.target: The maximum PIN length is 127 characters.

trans-unit.source: **Require lowercase letters in PIN**/**Require uppercase letters in PIN**/**Require special characters in PIN**.
trans-unit.target: **Require lowercase letters in PIN**/**Require uppercase letters in PIN**/**Require special characters in PIN**.

trans-unit.source: You can enforce a stronger PIN by requiring the use of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, and special characters in the PIN.
trans-unit.target: You can enforce a stronger PIN by requiring the use of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, and special characters in the PIN.

trans-unit.source: Choose from:
trans-unit.target: Choose from:

trans-unit.source: **Allowed**.
trans-unit.target: **Allowed**.

trans-unit.source: Users can use the character type in their PIN, but it is not mandatory.
trans-unit.target: Users can use the character type in their PIN, but it is not mandatory.

trans-unit.source: **Required**.
trans-unit.target: **Required**.

trans-unit.source: Users must include at least one of the character types in their PIN.
trans-unit.target: Users must include at least one of the character types in their PIN.

trans-unit.source: For example, it's common practice to require at least one uppercase letter and one special character.
trans-unit.target: For example, it's common practice to require at least one uppercase letter and one special character.

trans-unit.source: **Not allowed** (default).
trans-unit.target: **Not allowed** (default).

trans-unit.source: Users must not use these character types in their PIN.
trans-unit.target: Users must not use these character types in their PIN.

trans-unit.source: (This is also the behavior if the setting is not configured.)
trans-unit.target: (This is also the behavior if the setting is not configured.)

trans-unit.source: **PIN expiration (days)**.
trans-unit.target: **PIN expiration (days)**.

trans-unit.source: It's a good practice to specify an expiration period for a PIN, after which users must change it.
trans-unit.target: It's a good practice to specify an expiration period for a PIN, after which users must change it.

trans-unit.source: The default is 41 days.
trans-unit.target: The default is 41 days.

trans-unit.source: **Remember PIN history**.
trans-unit.target: **Remember PIN history**.

trans-unit.source: Restricts the reuse of previously used PINs.
trans-unit.target: Restricts the reuse of previously used PINs.

trans-unit.source: By default, the last 5 PINs cannot be reused.
trans-unit.target: By default, the last 5 PINs cannot be reused.

trans-unit.source: **Allow biometric authentication**.
trans-unit.target: **Allow biometric authentication**.

trans-unit.source: Enables biometric authentication, such as facial recognition or fingerprint, as an alternative to a PIN for Windows Hello for Business.
trans-unit.target: Enables biometric authentication, such as facial recognition or fingerprint, as an alternative to a PIN for Windows Hello for Business.

trans-unit.source: Users must still configure a work PIN in case biometric authentication fails.
trans-unit.target: Users must still configure a work PIN in case biometric authentication fails.

trans-unit.source: Choose from:
trans-unit.target: Choose from:

trans-unit.source: Windows Hello for Business allows biometric authentication.
trans-unit.target: Windows Hello for Business allows biometric authentication.

trans-unit.source: Windows Hello for Business prevents biometric authentication (for all account types).
trans-unit.target: Windows Hello for Business prevents biometric authentication (for all account types).

trans-unit.source: **Use enhanced anti-spoofing, when available**.
trans-unit.target: **Use enhanced anti-spoofing, when available**.

trans-unit.source: Configures whether the anti-spoofing features of Windows Hello are used on devices that support it (for example, detecting a photograph of a face instead of a real face).
trans-unit.target: Configures whether the anti-spoofing features of Windows Hello are used on devices that support it (for example, detecting a photograph of a face instead of a real face).

trans-unit.source: If this is set to **Yes**, Windows requires all users to use anti-spoofing for facial features when that is supported.
trans-unit.target: If this is set to **Yes**, Windows requires all users to use anti-spoofing for facial features when that is supported.

trans-unit.source: **Use phone sign-in**.
trans-unit.target: **Use phone sign-in**.

trans-unit.source: If this option is set to **Yes**, users can use a remote passport to serve as a portable companion device for desktop computer authentication.
trans-unit.target: If this option is set to **Yes**, users can use a remote passport to serve as a portable companion device for desktop computer authentication.

trans-unit.source: The desktop computer must be Azure Active Directory joined, and the companion device must be configured with a Windows Hello for Business PIN.
trans-unit.target: The desktop computer must be Azure Active Directory joined, and the companion device must be configured with a Windows Hello for Business PIN.

trans-unit.source: Further information
trans-unit.target: Further information

trans-unit.source: For more information about Microsoft Passport, see [the guide](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt589441.aspx) in the Windows 10 documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Microsoft Passport, see [the guide](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt589441.aspx) in the Windows 10 documentation.
